processors.name: mountainsort5
processors.help:
MountainSort is a CPU-based spike sorting software package developed by Jeremy Magland and others at Flatiron Institute in collaboration with researchers at Loren Frank's lab.
By employing Isosplit, a non-parametric density-based clustering approach, the software minimizes the need for manual intervention, thereby reducing errors and inconsistencies.
See https://github.com/flatironinstitute/mountainsort5 and https://doi.org/10.1016/j.neuron.2017.08.030
processors.label: MountainSort 5 spike sorter

parameters.name: detect_sign
parameters.help: Use -1 for detecting negative peaks, 1 for positive, 0 for both

parameters.name: detect_threshold
parameters.help: Detection threshold - recommend to use the default

parameters.name: detect_time_radius_msec
parameters.help: Determines the minimum allowable time interval between detected spikes in the same spatial region

parameters.name: electrical_series_path
parameters.help: Path to the electrical series in the NWB file, e.g., /acquisition/ElectricalSeries

parameters.name: npca_per_channel
parameters.help: Number of PCA features per channel in the initial dimension reduction step

parameters.name: npca_per_subdivision
parameters.help: Number of PCA features to compute at each stage of clustering in the isosplit6 subdivision method

parameters.name: preprocessing.filter
parameters.help: Enable or disable filter

parameters.name: preprocessing.freq_max
parameters.help: Low-pass filter cutoff frequency

parameters.name: preprocessing.freq_min
parameters.help: High-pass filter cutoff frequency

parameters.name: preprocessing.whiten
parameters.help: Enable or disable whiten

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.help: Which sorting scheme to use: 1, 2, or 3

parameters.name: scheme1_detect_channel_radius
parameters.help: Channel radius for excluding events that are too close in time in scheme 1

parameters.name: scheme2.scheme2_detect_channel_radius
parameters.help: Channel radius for excluding events that are too close in time during phase 2 of scheme 2

parameters.name: scheme2.scheme2_max_num_snippets_per_training_batch
parameters.help: Maximum number of snippets to use in each batch for training during phase 2 of scheme 2

parameters.name: scheme2.scheme2_phase1_detect_channel_radius
parameters.help: Channel radius for excluding events that are too close in time during phase 1 of scheme 2

parameters.name: scheme2.scheme2_training_duration_sec
parameters.help: Duration of training data to use in scheme 2

parameters.name: scheme2.scheme2_training_recording_sampling_mode
parameters.help: initial or uniform

parameters.name: scheme3_block_duration_sec
parameters.help: Duration of each block in scheme 3

parameters.name: snippet_T1
parameters.help: Number of samples before the peak to include in the snippet

parameters.name: snippet_T2
parameters.help: Number of samples after the peak to include in the snippet

parameters.name: snippet_mask_radius
parameters.help: Radius of the mask to apply to the extracted snippets

parameters.name: test_duration_sec
parameters.help: For testing purposes: duration of the recording in seconds (0 means all)

processors.name: ms5_quicktest
processors.help: For running tests. Runs MountainSort5 scheme 1 with default parameters on the first portion of the recording.
